content: in 2022 a notary named j from the office of notaries called n was involved in a legal matter two belgian nationals referred to as mr x and mrs x have decided to proceed with a divorce by mutual consent they have agreed to settle their mutual rights according to specific articles of the judicial code the text explains that mr and mrs x were married in 2013 under a pure separation of property regime they have children together and from previous relationships the couple has requested a notary to provide a detailed statement of their assets and debts as well as draw up an inventory of their assets they have already divided their household items by mutual agreement the text also mentions the ownership of vehicles and the division of various assets and debts the parties declare their ownership of real estate discuss the payment of insurance premiums and income taxes and agree on the responsibility for repayment of outstanding debts they have agreed that the surviving spouse will have rights to the estate of the deceased spouse and have renounced any benefits entitled to them under the marriage contract the spouses acknowledge the property allocated to each of them and agree to bear their own liabilities they have also agreed on arrangements regarding their children and waived any maintenance allowance the divorce proceedings will be governed by the family court and the costs and fees related to the divorce will be shared equally between the parties the parties declare that they have no further claims or rights to each others property the document is confirmed by a notary and the parties acknowledge their understanding of their rights and obligations
